intro: Cleome kermesina var. plebeia, commonly known as the common cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual with slender, branching stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to white, which bloom throughout the summer. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil make it a common weed in gardens and fields. The plant's botanical features include showy inflorescences and a fibrous root system.
